page.title: 14Carlton Curlieu
page.content: The Parish Carlton Curlieu, which is 1406 acres in area, lies 9 miles south-east of the city of Leicester. It is bounded on the north by the Gartree Road and on the west by one of the main tributaries of the River Seuce. The village stands above a 450ft. contour line on sand and gravel. The soil in the parish is a loamy clay. No main roads cross the parish. The population of the parish has never been large and was perhaps larger in the Middle Ages than it has been since. According to the Domesday Survey there were 24 inhabitants. By 1911 this had risen to a high of 93, but today the population is 45. The village consists of a few farmhouses and cottages grouped near the church with a fine Manor House to the south east. Most of the houses are red brick built in the early 19th century.
